intro: Kiharapyrum, commonly known as the silverleaf orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage and delicate, fragrant blooms. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Its flowers typically bloom in late spring and early summer, adding a unique aesthetic to its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific growing conditions, Kiharapyrum is considered a rare and endangered species.
